Description: Sherd (mended from two fragments) of Laconian black-glazed pottery volute-krater giving rim, neck and shoulder; interior: glazed dull black save streak at top of shoulder: exterior glazed save for outside and underside of rim, which have a creamy slip; on outside band of chevrons between lines; also the glaze on top of the rim is interrupted at the right break, as if in the vicinity of a handle.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.41, although that piece has continuous blaze on the top of the rim.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 562, no. E46)
Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 93, no. B23, pl. 4, no. 2.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.36) (phase 3)
